text: Gita Ramjee (née Parekh; 8 April 1956 – 31 March 2020) was a Ugandan-South African scientist and researcher in HIV prevention. In 2018, she was awarded the ‘Outstanding Female Scientist’ award from the European and Developing Countries Clinical Trials Partnership. Ramjee died in Umhlanga, Durban, South Africa, from COVID-19 related problems on 31 March 2020. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Ugandan people Category:South African scientists Category:Medical researchers Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Durban
title: Gita Ramjee
